data.text:
Author Archive

Patricia C. (Stewart) Oliver

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Patricia C. Oliver, age 64 of East Smiley, Shelby, died Wednesday, October 11, 2006 at Med Central Shelby Hospital after a long illness.

She was born April 8, 1942 in Clearfield, Kentucky the daughter of the late William C. and Leoma (Johnson) Stewart. She was a 1960 graduate of Shelby High School and attended Mansfield General Hospital School of Nursing. Patty was a former employee of Norman Straw M.D. She worked at the Shelby Y for J-teen where she taught baton lessons and also at Carolyn Wilkinson Studios in Shelby where she taught dance. She enjoyed outdoors especially swimming and hiking. She was particularly proud of receiving a trophy for her water skiing skills. Her hobby was writing poetry.

Patty is survived by her husband, William Hollie Oliver whom she married on December 16, 1978; 3 daughters and spouses: Kelly and Bruce Adams of Springfield, Kimberly and Vince Raska of Springfield, and Kacey Scott of Columbus; 7 grandchildren; a brother and his wife, Donald and Mary Stewart of Shelby. She was preceded in death by her parents, a sister Phyllis Rae Schlotterer and her children’s father, Commodore Perry Sexton, Jr.

There will be no calling hours. Graveside services will be held at 12:00 Noon on Saturday, October 14, 2006 at Oakland Cemetery in Shelby. Memorial expressions may be made to the charity of the donor’s choice. The Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby assisted the family with funeral arrangements.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

L. Jeannette (Kuhn) Oates

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

L. Jeannette Oates, age 88, formerly of Shelby Avenue, Shelby, died unexpectedly Thursday, October 19, 2006 at her home in Hilliard, Ohio.

Jeannette was born May 8, 1918 in Shelby the daughter of the late Orvie W. and Ethel (Hawk) Kuhn. She was a 1936 graduate of Shelby High School and was the head bookkeeper at the Citizens Bank for many years, retiring in 1979. She was an active member of First Lutheran Church, Business and Professional Women’s Club and was a 60 year member of Beta Sigma Phi Sorority. She took pleasure in playing bingo and working puzzle books. She especially enjoyed spending time visiting with her family and friends.

She is survived by her son and daughter-in-law, Greg and Pam Davis of Dublin, Ohio; 2 granddaughters, Becky Davis of Hilliard, Ohio and Lindsay Davis of Charlotte, North Carolina; a sister, Marjorie Pugh of Lima, Ohio; Numerous nieces and nephews. Jeannette was preceded in death by her parents, her first husband, Marlin J. Davis in 1969, her second husband, John S. Oates in 1992, two sisters, Corinne Kuhn and Maryann Wallace, and two brothers, Dwight Kuhn and Leon Kuhn.

Friends may call on Sunday, October 22, 2006 from 2-4 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby and also from 9:30-10:15 AM on Monday at the First Lutheran Church, 33 Broadway, Shelby. Funeral services will be Monday at 10:30 AM with Rev. Steven C. Bond and Rev. Warren Reichert officiating. Burial will be in Oakland Cemetery in Shelby. Memorial expressions may be made to the church.

E-mail condolences to:

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Elmer T. Reed

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Elmer T. Reed, age 87, of Bendle Ave., Shelby, died Friday, October 20, 2006 at his home after a long illness.

He was born April 14, 1919 in Youngstown, Ohio the son of the late Charles C. and Minniella (Rice) Reed. He graduated from Campbell Memorial High School in Youngstown. He was an Army Veteran of World War II serving in the European Theater and the Battle of The Bulge. He retired in 1984 from Quanex as superintendent of maintenance; Prior to that, he worked at Youngstown Sheet and Tube Company. He was a member of the Shelby Masonic Lodge #350 F&AM and Shelby American Legion O’Brien Post #326. He was a volunteer at Auburn Elementary School, with his wife, helping children read. They were lovingly referred to by the students as Grandma and Grandpa READ. He taught Country Western Pattern Dancing at Auburn School and at the Senior Center.

He is survived by his wife, Virginia M. (Homack) Reed, whom he wed in November 1945; 3 daughters and sons-in-law, Susan and Wilbur Green of Plymouth, Kathy and Bob Cline of Shelby, Maribeth and Jim Baldridge of West Liberty; a son and daughter-in-law, David and Kay Reed of Shelby; 7 grandchildren; 9 great grandchildren; a sister, Edith Ferrando of Youngstown. He was preceded in death by a granddaughter, Megan Paulo, 2 brothers, William and Thomas Reed and 2 sisters, Clarinda Reed and Emma Guynan.

Calling hours will not be observed. Graveside services will be held at 11:00 AM Wednesday, October 25, 2006 at Greenlawn Cemetery in Plymouth with Bill Leding, Chaplain of Richland County Joint Veterans Burial Detail, officiating. Military honors will also be conducted by the Joint Veterans Burial Detail. Memorial expressions may be made to Med Central Hospice, 335 Glessner Avenue, Mansfield, Ohio 44903. The Turner Funeral Home, Shelby, assisted the family with funeral arrangements.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Dean Howard Ferrell

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Dean Howard Ferrell, age 84 of Taylortown Road, Mansfield, died Wednesday, October 25, 2006 at the Crestwood Care Center in Shelby.

He was born July 25, 1922 in Butler Township, Richland County, Ohio the of the late Rollo and Ozra (Kerr) Ferrell. He was a 1940 graduate of Union High School and was an Army veteran of WWII serving in the Battle Of The Buldge. He was a retired farmer and truck driver. He was a member of Clay Memorial Lutheran Church, Shelby American Legion O’Brien Post #326, Shiloh Masonic Lodge #544 F & AM, The Society for the Preservation and Encouragement of Barber Shop Quartet Singing in America and the Fun Center Chordsmen. He was instrumental in starting the Franklin Township Fire Department. Dean was very proud of his Harley motorcycle. He thoroughly enjoyed the times he and his wife Mildred traveled extensively on his Harley.

Dean is survived by his wife: Mildred (Durant) Kuhn Ferrell; a son and spouse: Allan and Annette Ferrell of Crestline; 3 daughters and spouse: Barbara Jo Dunn of Florida, Jean Ann Ferrell of North Carolina and Linda and John Shuler of North Carolina; 7 grandchildren; 2 great grandchildren; a sister: Glenna Bray of Shiloh; a stepson and spouse: Jeffrey and Karen Kuhn of Mansfield; 2 step granddaughters.

Friends may call on Sunday, October 29, 2006 from 2-5 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby where Masonic services will be conducted at 4:45 PM. Funeral services will be held on Monday, at 10 AM at the funeral home with Pastor Dianna Seaman, officiating. Burial will be in Mt. Hope Cemetery in Shiloh. Military honors will be conducted at the gravesite by Richland County Joint Veterans Burial Detail. Memorial expressions may be made to Clay Memorial Lutheran Church or to the Fun Center Chordsman.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Eileen E. (Fackler) Kirkpatrick

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Eileen E. Kirkpatrick, age 79, of East Smiley Avenue, Shelby, died Thursday, October 26, 2006 at Med Central Shelby Hospital after a short illness.

She was born April 15, 1927 in Jackson Township, Richland County, Ohio the daughter of the late Alfred and Fleta (Pittinger) Fackler. She was a 1945 graduate of Shelby High School. After high school, she attended Moody Bible Institute in Chicago. She was encouraged by Miss Josephine Hoover to go into nursing and graduated from Swedish Covenant School of Nursing in Chicago. Eileen loved to travel and she started her nursing career in Arizona, moving on to California, Berea, Ohio and then back to Shelby to be a special nurse when her nieces were born. She was the head nurse at Shelby Memorial Hospital for many years, retiring in 1981. She was an active member of the First Baptist Church in Shelby where she spent time visiting the shut-ins and taking them meals. Her hobbies included sewing and gardening. She will be remembered by her family for the beautiful suits, coats and dresses she made for her nieces. Eileen was very tenderhearted, with a love of all animals, which she often made her pets.

Eileen is survived by her husband, Joseph Kirkpatrick, whom she wed on March 23, 1963; a brother and his wife, Clarence and Evelyn Fackler of Shelby; a sister and her husband, Virginia and William Hettinger of Shelby; Nieces and Nephews. She was preceded in death by her niece, Janet Anderson Straw, and by 2 sisters-in-law, Jane Anderson and Doris Smith.

Friends may call on Sunday, October 29, from 2-5 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby. Funeral services will be held on Monday at 12:30 PM at the First Baptist Church, Gamble Street, Shelby with her pastor, Rev. Robert Becker officiating. Burial will be in Adams Cemetery on Bowman Street Road. Memorial expressions may be made to the church or the Gideons.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Mona C. (Weddell) Pry

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Mona C. Pry, age 68, of 200 Joelynn Drive, Shelby, died Thursday, November 16, 2006 at Med Central Shelby Hospital after a long illness.

She was born November 9, 1938 in Mansfield the daughter of the late Arden F. and Loella M. (Barnhart) Weddell. Mona was a 1956 graduate of Shelby High School and was a homemaker. She was a former employee of Mansfield Distributing and had been an Avon Representative for many years. She was a member of Trinity United Methodist Church.

Mona is survived by her husband, Kenneth W. Pry, whom she wed on

May 7, 1972; a brother, David Weddell of Coconut Beach, Florida; Aunts and Uncles, Merrill Junior and Barbara Barnhart of Shelby, Tom and Verda Barnhart of Michigan, Ardelle and Floyd Rietveld of Dayton, RheaBelle Hartman of Shelby, Bonnie Ginter of Shelby, Laura Weddell of Wooster and Mildred Barnhart of Shelby. She was preceded in death by her father in 1969, her mother in 2004 and by several uncles.

Funeral services will be held on Saturday, November 18, 2006 at 11:30 AM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby with Rev. David Carter officiating. Visitation will be one hour prior to the funeral service from 10:30 AM – 11:30 AM. Burial will be in Oakland Cemetery in Shelby.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Gordon V. Sharpless

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Gordon Vernon Sharpless, age 85, of Taylortown Road, Shelby, died Saturday, November 18, 2006 at the Heritage Care Center after a short illness.

He was born January 24, 1921 in Greenwich, Ohio the son of the late Harry and Jane (Brown) Sharpless. Mr. Sharpless was the former owner of Sharpless Texaco Gas Station on the square in downtown Plymouth for 30 years and then operated the Sohio Gas Station in Shelby for 15 years. He was an Army veteran of WWII.

Gordon is survived by his wife, Marrietta Mae (Schiefer) Sharpless whom he wed on April 15, 1944; 2 daughters and their husbands, Gwen and Bernard Rush of Baldwinsville, NY and Linda and Trent Sponseller of Shelby; 5 grandchildren, Christa Sponseller, Rachel Robinson, Kevin Sponseller, Zachery and Joel Rush; a great grandson, Nicholas Robinson.

He was preceded in death by his parents and 5 brothers, Edward, Virgil, James, Harry and Dale Sharpless.

Friends may call on Wednesday, November 22, 2006 from 1-2 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby, where funeral services will be held at 2 PM. Burial will be in Little London Cemetery with military honors conducted by the Shelby American Legion. Memorial expressions may be made to the American Diabetes Association.

E-mail condolences to:

turnerfuneralhome@neo.rr.com

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

Dorothy I. (Worthington) Roth

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

Dorothy I. Roth, age 91, of Shelby, died Sunday, November 19, 2006 at the Crestwood Care Center after a long illness.

She was born July 5, 1915, in Shelby, the daughter of the late Otis R. and Zula B. (Viers) Worthington. Dorothy was a 1934 graduate of Shelby High School and was a homemaker. She was a member of First Lutheran Church in Shelby, Shelby VFW Ladies Auxiliary, and Shiloh American Legion Ladies Auxiliary. She enjoyed playing bingo and watching the Shelby Lady Whippets and the Ohio State Buckeyes.

Dorothy is survived by a daughter and son-in-law, Judy and Richard Messner of Shelby; a daughter-in-law, Connie Roth of Shelby; 6 grandchildren and their families, Jerry and Lynette Roth and their children, Nikki, Alison, Ashleigh, and Rachael; John and Theresa Roth; Jodi and Chris Korbas and their children, Konnor and Kody; Russ and Jodi Messner and their children, Courtney, Shawnee and Cole; Michelle and Garth Montgomery and their children, Erik and Evan; and Matthew and Wendy Messner. She is also survived by a brother and his wife, Rolla and Mary Worthington of Shelby and 2 brothers-in-law, Dean Viers of Fairborn and Howard Ross of Shelby; a sister-in-law and her husband, Margaret and Walter Winkle of North Field, Ohio. She was preceded in death by her husband, Dean L. Roth in 1986, a son, James Roth in 1999, 2 brothers, Harley and Rollin Worthington and 3 sisters, Mary Viers, Zulabelle Zooty Ross and Helen Worthington.

Friends may call on Tuesday, November 21, 2006 from 2-4 and 6-8 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby, where funeral services will be held on Wednesday at 10 AM with Pastor Steven C. Bond officiating. Burial will be in Maple Grove Cemetery in New Haven. Memorial expressions may be made to First Lutheran Church Food Bank or Shelby Help Line Ministries.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

John F. Scott

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

John F. Scotty Scott, age 77 of 72 Park Avenue, Shelby, died Friday, December 01, 2006 at the Crestwood Care Center after a long illness.

He was born July 29, 1929 in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania the son of the late Walter M. and Ruth (Roberts) Scott. He was a truck driver most of his life and served in the United States Marine Corps. Prior to moving to Ohio, Scotty was a volunteer on the Wilkes-Barre Fire Department for 25 years serving as captain of the EMT Unit for 15 years. He was a member of the Moose Lodge, Eagles, Scottish American Military Society, VFW, and the American Legion. He was very proud to be a Clan Scott member.

Scotty was actively involved with music all of his life, playing the guitar, harmonica and singing in various groups.

He is survived by his wife, Naomi (Hawkins) Scott, whom he wed in December of 2003; 3 daughters, Linda Scott, Sandy Scott, and Jackie Scott all of Pennsylvania; 3 grandchildren; 2 great grandchildren; 6 step children, Thelma Ball and Nadene Johnson both of Shelby, Ruby Long of Plymouth, Cathy Feltner of Tiro, Johnny Cole and Jody Cole both of Mansfield; 16 step grandchildren; 5 step great grandchildren; Special adopted son, Ernie Kapko of Mountain Top, Pennsylvania.

Friends may call on Wednesday, December 6, 2006 from 3-4 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby, where funeral services will be at 4 PM conducted by Rev. Benjamin Roby, Chaplain of North Central Ohio Hospice. Military Honors will be conducted at the funeral home by the Shelby American Legion. Memorial expressions may be made to Hospice of North Central Ohio.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »

John A. “Johnny” Metzger

Wednesday, April 17th, 2013

John A. Johnny Metzger, age 88, of Seltzer Avenue, Shelby, died Wednesday, December 27, 2006 at his home.

He was born September 3, 1918 in Shelby the son of the late John and Edith (Dallas) Metzger. He was a 1937 graduate of Tiro High School and a Army veteran of World War II where he was a message runner to the front lines. Johnny was a 31 year employee of Ohio Seamless Tube Company in Shelby. After his retirement from the Tuby, he worked for Crest Binding in New Washington for 18 years. He was a member of Our Mother of Perpetual Help Traditional Catholic Church in Sulphur Springs and was a former member of the Shelby Knights of Columbus. Johnny enjoyed the surroundings of his home either in the garden or tinkering in the garage.

A true handyman, he took great pleasure in helping his kids in any way.

John is survived by his wife of 66 years, Dortha M. (Studer) Metzger, whom he wed on June 1, 1940; 5 children and spouses, Steve and Carol Metzger of Park City, KY, Don and Marilyn Metzger of Willard, Sharon Nedolast, Robert and Jeanne Metzger, Michael and Kathy Metzger all of Shelby; 15 grandchildren; 19 great grandchildren; a brother, Herman Metzger of Crestline. He was preceded in death by 4 brothers, Paul, Dallas, Victor, and Cecil Metzger.

Friends may call on Friday, December 29, 2006 from 2-4 and 6-8 PM at the Turner Funeral Home, 168 West Main Street, Shelby, where the rosary will be recited at 8:00 PM. Funeral Mass will be held on Saturday, December 30, 2006 at 10:00 AM at Our Mother Of Perpetual Help Traditional Catholic Church in Sulphur Springs with Father James McGilloway, CMRI, officiating. Burial will be in Most Pure Heart of Mary Catholic Cemetery in Shelby with military honors. Memorial expressions may be made to Our Mother of Perpetual Help Church for Masses.

Posted in Obituaries | No Comments »
